issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: The problem is a duplicate of an existing issue.
resolution.name: Duplicate

fields.summary: CloudFormation waitcondition handle url should use hostname not IP

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description:
I've been porting my manual mostly distributed install procedure to 4.2 to handle the euca2ools and install script changes, and am just getting around to testing the demo scripts which were developed under 4.1. When I attempted to re-run demo 30: wordpress repatriation, the CloudFormation Stack under Euca was failing. Same stack works under AWS still.

I went into the instance once it was created and tailed /var/log/cloud-init-output.log to see what was happening, as this template does a lot of configuration and can take a while. It seems there's some problem once the initialization has completed and cloud-init attempts to signal success. See attached log file. This has worked prior to 4.2 on all systems where I've run it, and if you want, I can re-run this on a demo system that has not been upgraded to 4.2 to get comparable log output which succeeds, just let me know.
fields.summary: cloud-init script which worked under 4.1.2 no longer works in 4.2

comments.body:
File I'm using added. This can also be found inside the euca-demo project, from where I pull it during demo setup to add a row in the AWSRegionArch2AMI map specifying the EMI to use for each Euca region where I run this: 

https://github.com/eucalyptus/euca-demo/blob/feature/4.2/demos/demo-30-cfn-wordpress/templates/WordPress_Single_Instance_Eucalyptus.template

Here's an example of the rows I add.

    "AWSRegionArch2AMI" : {
      "hp-gol01-d8"    : { "PV64" : "emi-2e8c4591", "HVM64" : "emi-2e8c4591", "HVMG2" : "NOT_SUPPORTED" },
      "hp-aw2-2"       : { "PV64" : "emi-df4eb2ab", "HVM64" : "emi-df4eb2ab", "HVMG2" : "NOT_SUPPORTED" },
      "us-east-1"      : { "PV64" : "ami-8e682ce6", "HVM64" : "ami-08842d60", "HVMG2" : "ami-3a329952"  },
... etc ...

This template, including the Euca region rows, has been working since early summer. This is now our primary demo to customers, I can't upgrade clouds to demo new features until this is working again.
[~mcrawford], so you have verified that the attached template works on 4.1.2?
[~mcrawford], the attached template uses resources that are not defined in the template. Please provide full steps to reproduce the issue, including creation of any external resources.

[~sjones] I generally document or script all my work in the GitHub euca-demo project, top of which can be found here: [https://github.com/eucalyptus/euca-demo/tree/feature/4.2] Note "feature/4.2" branch which is where I'm making all changes for 4.2 before I merge to master. Master has everything which worked against 4.1.

I'm still working through converting my procedures and scripts to work with all the 4.2 changes related to how credentials are managed and the euare method signature differences, with that work on feature/4.2 branch.

Here is my latest version of the manual procedure used to create my hp-gol01-d8 cloud where I'm seeing this problem: [https://github.com/eucalyptus/euca-demo/blob/feature/4.2/installs/install-20-manual/docs/install-20-manual-install-hp-gol01-d8.md]. This is mostly accurate, with these exceptions:
* I'm not installing any iptables rules, but "chkconfig iptables off; service iptables off" instead, until I know everything works properly.
* NCs 3 and 4 no longer exist, but I have a spare NC I'm adding as a single NC on cluster B.
* Skipping install of support keypair, as the procedure there doesn't work, noticed IRC thread on what needs to be done, just haven't tried it yet.
*  Under section "Replace Management Console Nginx Implementation with an Alternative which also supports UFS", I am doing that, and it appears to be working for both console and UFS when accessed from another host running Euca2ools 3.2, but getting a 403 error when running Euca2ools 3.3 on the CLC itself. Strange I can go through SSL Nginx proxy via AWSCLI, just not Euca2ools, unlike exact technique with 4.1.2 + 3.2. So, I'm leaving the Euca2ools [region] config with http://<DNS>:8773/ endpoints instead of switching to https://<DNS>/ for now, unlike what I had in place for 4.1 clouds. Please ping me to walk through this if what you see there isn't clear.

I either run through this type of manual install, or I have a set of scripts which wrap, then augment FastStart to add the same extra features (DNS, PKI, SSL reverse proxy, AWSCLI config) for my PRC demo environments or the two hpcloud demo environments created for Discover. You might want to look at the manual procedures which describe how I setup the hp-gol01-f2 and hp-gol01-f3 4.1.2 environments where this worked as a comparison to what I'm manually doing now for 4.2, which can be found here: [https://github.com/eucalyptus/euca-demo/tree/master/installs/install-10-faststart/docs]. I normally run the bash shell scripts (relative ../bin) but these procedures are easier to read and identical. I ran these in order to create the 4.1.2 working environments:
* install-10-faststart-install.md
* install-11-faststart-configure-dns.md
* install-12-faststart-configure-pki.md
* install-13-faststart-configure-proxy.md
* install-15-faststart-configure-support.md
* install-16-faststart-configure-awscli.md
* install-19-faststart-update-console.md

Once I am at this point, reached via either method, I next have a set of bash scripts or equivalent manual procedures (both exist so I can run/show scripts in demos, but refer viewers to the procedures which more simply/clearly show the exact steps) which initialize the new cloud for demos, including installing images, creating accounts, setting up Euca2ools and AWSCLI credentials files, and roles, groups with IAM policies and users, which are the "baseline" for any demos where I don't want to show such setup. This is what you're looking for with the missing resources, I think. 

This is also where there's the most churn and instability as these scripts are the most affected by the 4.2 euare- and euserv- and get-credentials changes - still haven't finished all fixes, and big changes between master and feature/4.2 branches. View the master branch to see what I ran on top of the 4.1.2 clouds mentioned above. View the feature/4.2 branch to see what I ran manually to create the objects on the 4.2 cloud with the problem. [https://github.com/eucalyptus/euca-demo/tree/feature/4.2/demos/demo-00-initialize/docs] When you see two scripts which are named identically except one has "-awscli" in the name, they perform identical steps, except one uses Euca2ools and the other uses AWSCLI, to show how either tool can be used. To setup the 4.2 cloud, I ran these procedures:
* demo-00-initialize.md
* demo-01-initialize-account.md
* demo-02-initialize-account-administrator.md (to create Administrators group with mcrawford user/member)
* demo-03-initialize-account-dependencies.md <== this is what creates most of the external resources

Again, I think these were run verbatim, with possible exception of switch to use of http endpoints because of issue mentioned above where https endpoints were not working via Euca2ools. Wanted to debug that more before I approached Garrett.

I can rebuild this cloud while you watch today if you want, takes about an hour. LMK. We can also just try to run this demo and show the problem as it exists now.

The template worked for me on 4.1.2 and on 4.2.0, output from 4.2.0:

{code}
#
# cat DemosRoleTrustPolicy.json 
{
    "Version": "2012-10-17",
    "Statement": [
        {
            "Effect": "Allow",
            "Principal": { "Service": "ec2.amazonaws.com"},
            "Action": "sts:AssumeRole"
        }
    ]
}
#
#
# cat DemosRolePolicy.json 
{
    "Version": "2012-10-17",
    "Statement": [
        {
            "Action": [
                "cloudformation:DescribeStacks",
                "cloudformation:DescribeStackEvents",
                "cloudformation:DescribeStackResource",
                "cloudformation:DescribeStackResources",
                "cloudformation:GetTemplate",
                "cloudformation:List*",
                "ec2:Describe*",
                "s3:Get*",
                "s3:List*"
            ],
            "Effect": "Allow",
            "Resource": "*"
        },
        {
            "Action": [
                "s3:PutObject",
                "s3:GetObject",
                "s3:DeleteObject",
                "s3:PutObjectAcl",
                "s3:PutObjectVersionAcl"
            ],
            "Effect": "Allow",
            "Resource": "arn:aws:s3:::demo-${account}/*"
        }
    ]
}
#
#
# euare-rolecreate -r Demos -f DemosRoleTrustPolicy.json
#
#
# euare-roleuploadpolicy -r Demos -p DemosPolicy -f DemosRolePolicy.json
#
#
# euform-create-stack --template-file WordPress_Single_Instance_Eucalyptus.template -p KeyName=root -p DBUser=user -p DBPassword=password -p DBRootPassword=password --capabilities CAPABILITY_IAM wordpress-1 
arn:aws:cloudformation::000298915535:stack/wordpress-1/263f7bda-1f4d-4f48-8f65-174c01d87e70

This template installs WordPress with a local MySQL database for storage. It demonstrates using the AWS CloudFormation bootstrap scripts to deploy WordPress. [~sjones] Just added most recent run. Still not working for me. Would appreciate some help with my 8-host fully distributed system manually built in PRC to help understand why this might be working for you but not me.

Do you have some time today to help debug this? I have built this cloud using this script (different than the one where I originally reported this - this has separate CLC UFS+MC, while prior variant had CLC+UFS+MC):

https://github.com/eucalyptus/euca-demo/blob/feature/4.2/installs/install-20-manual/docs/install-20-manual-install-hp-gol01-d6.md
We believe the linked tickets (created in response to this one) cover the problems described here. Please, file additional tickets if something is missing.
